alert.note: Alert for Kimble; McCulloch; Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 6:35PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kimble, southwestern McCulloch and Menard Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 635 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1773, or 9 miles northwest of Saline, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Menard, Yates Crossing, Saline, London, Hext, Fort Mckavett, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773, Camp Sol Mayer, Us- 377 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line, Us-190 Near The Menard- Mcculloch County Line, Cleo, Us-83 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line and The Intersection Of Us-83 And Highway 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
